HOTEL THE CELESTINE KYOTO GION
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 88 reviews

It's a brand new 5 star hotel (opened in September 2017). The location is just perfect for us as we had gotten the hotel to make most of our restaurants reservations, mostly around the GION district area.

Quite a number of sightseeing places (famous Shrines & Temples) are within walking distance. It is especially good for us as we can walk off the calories after our lunch and before heading back to hotel to freshen up and then for dinner. The room size is pretty good and everything is so new and clean.. even the hotel smells good too! Room rate is considered reasonable given the high rates in most hotels in Kyoto. Overall,we are happy and satisfied with the stay at Celestine Kyoto Gion. The only problem (not big though) is you have to be rather patience with the staff if communicating in English with them. Anyway, will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Show more
Geraldine , Singapore
Kyoto Century Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 1687 reviews

We chose this hotel for location, close to JR station, making it convenient to travel day trips by JR.

The hotel was newly renovated, so all room and facilities are nice and clean. It is a non smoking hotel. Staff polite and helpful. We were very happy that we got upgraded to a deluxe room, that make our stay even more memorable. The breakfast was excellent although the food is pretty much the same each morning. We had the Valentine' Day dinner in the hotel, and the food was great, over all, a very happy stay. The sink is separated from the toilet/bathroom, which is a convenient design. One minor thing is that there is no soap available next to the sink and we have to go back to the bathroom to squeeze liquid soap to clean up our hands each time after toilet.

Show more
Kwok , Australia
HOTEL MYSTAYS Kyoto-Shijo
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3328 reviews

Very close to bus station, which is important because bus is the best way to tour Kyoto. A short 5-10 min bus ride to the Kyoto station, which will easily take you to anywhere.

The staff is very helpful, friendly, and communicate in English well. The room is big in Japanese standard and very clean. We didn't try the dining hall but there's a supermarket, convenience store, several restaurants right next to the hotel. A short 10 min walk will take you to the busy Shijo area and Nishiki market. Would definitely stay here again!

Show more
Emma , Taiwan
Hotel New Hankyu Kyoto
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3015 reviews

Location was a short walking distance from the Kyoto station and the Post Office. It is on the same street as the Kyoto Tower and the bus terminal is nearby.

Room size was the smallest of the 3 hotels. Although the rooms looked like it has been renovated recently, there are no black out blinds or curtains. It was terrible to be awoken by the bright daylight at 4am. We asked for eye shades and hotel staff told us there were none provided by hotel. We have had the worst sleep in Hotel New Hankyu Kyoto Hotel.

Show more
Claire , Singapore
Hotel Gracery Kyoto Sanjo
9.3 Exceptional
Based on 379 reviews

This was our first trip to Kyoto and I debated between this hotel and another hotel a little further away with large, designer rooms for a little more money.

So glad we chose this one for its location. Lots of good shops right outside door in pedestrian zone (though that means taxi won't be able to drop or pick up immediately in front of hotel) and excellent restaurants within walking distance. Nishiki market nearby and Gion about 10-15 minute walk. Subway station ~12 minutes walk. Rooms were comfortable and clean but tight.

Show more
Frank , United States
Hotel M's Plus Shijo Omiya
8.9 Excellent
Based on 932 reviews

I lost my backpacker in JR West train from KIX to Kyoto. I requested the hotel front desk a staff to enquire the JR 's parties to check any loss and found in the train.

He told me as the counter was closed on 20:00 and will enquire them on tomorrow. As my Japanese language is poor and tell me the backpacker color and what time lost in express. Who promised me should checking​ it. Next day we go to sightseeing Kyoto and back to hotel on afternoon to hearing any good news. Unfortunately, he are not on duty and only simple memo said that not found replied by JR's. So sad, I decided to go to Kyoto JP station on next day and want to enquire this. The JR staff replied can contact their lost and found department on station to check any lost and found but they are closed on 1930. Next day I contact lost and found department and they found my backerpacker. So, have hotel staff is take any action to help me or skimp me to destroy my found my lost opportunity in due course!

Show more
Wing , Hong Kong
Kyoto Brighton Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 593 reviews

Excelent hotel, not so good location unless one knows about the shuttle bus! The shuttle bus connects to Karasuma Oike subway station which is perfect for both enjoying the city and to get to/from the railway station.

We didn't know about the shuttle bus when we got to the hotel, so we had to walk about 15 minutes under heavy rain. The hotel staff was really nice to relief us from the burden of our luggage and also provide umbrellas once they saw us. The hotel is excelent, the staff knows great English, the room was big and with all the facilities one would expect from a 5 star hotel. Great value for the money I would say. Also worth to know that the hotel is close to the Kyoto Imperial Palace Gardens, which provide an excelent place for a morning jogging and also for a very relaxing walk at any time of day and weather.

Show more
Dragos , Romania
Natural Hot Spring Dormy Inn Premium Kyoto Ekimae
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1969 reviews

My wife and I were lucky to find a room at Dormy Inn in Kyoto just after the new year. The first few days before and after the new year are the busy days in Kyoto.

Dormy Inn is just a few steps away from the Kyoto Station North exit. The cleanliness of the room and friendliness of the staff was excellent. By the way, the room where we stayed was roomy and comfy. My wife and I enjoyed the hot springs which were open from 3pm to 9am. A complimentary bowl of Ramen was available in the evening.The WIFI connected was also very good. The bus station and subway stop are also a few steps away. We recommend getting a day or two day bus and subway pass to see the Kyoto attractions. Having the pass would save you a lot of walking.There are a lot of good restaurants nearby (all kinds not just Japanese or Asian) - at the train station/mall area. We highly recommend Dormy Inn if you are going to visit Kyoto.

Show more
Renato , United States
Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Kyoto Premier
9.3 Exceptional
Based on 289 reviews

My family of five had a wonderful stay at this property. Our three kids, 14, 12, & 10, had a room around the corner in a twin + rollaway, it was called a triple.

My partner and I shared a twin double, which two beds were pushed together (I don't quite get this, but it worked out just fine). We were located on the 2nd floor, which was free of any of the smoke issues as reported by other reviewers. My opinion is, that if you are concerned with smoking as I am, you really have to call a manager on the property, and ask what their policies are on smoking. Japan is still a country in transition when it comes to the definition of a "non-smoking room". The entire property is very clean, and well appointed. The location is excellent --between the bustle of downtown and gion. The property sits alongside the riverside, and is a block away from the two major subway lines. Hint, the subway passes are different between the two systems :) Runners and bikers (another hint, rent a bike and ride along the river paved paths) will love this location. Adults will love the public baths... The rooms are "cozy", but on par with other boutique hotels. The triple rooms were tight on space. The twin, had a small couch and table. There is a washer dryer on site (one on the mens side, and two on the women's). the women's machine is available only to women. The english of the staff can be a little rough, but there was always someone available who could come in and help a poor english only speaking person like myself. The breakfast is EXCELLENT. However, unless it is included for free, I would suggest that you purchase it on your first morning... and then forage outside afterwards in the many options in the neighborhood. I think it's about ~2500 yen. It's just a lot of food! Do take advantage of the hotel's excellent, knowledgeable, thoughful concierge. They also have a fancy coin machine, which my kids loved, that will convert your bag full of coins into larger more

Show more
michael , United States
Hotel Granvia Kyoto
9 Excellent
Based on 1398 reviews

The JR station in Kyoto is a city within itself, and the Hotel Granvia is the Manor House. The place is immense.

Upon arrival, looking out from a window onto the city, the thought of venturing into the streets on foot was daunting. How long would it take to escape the station complex and start a walking tour was an uncomfortable thought. The Granvia concierge was excellent in English and cheerful and patient in marking up a city map for us, but still we were stumbling around for a while. Nevertheless, we finally found the subway entrance, and finally got some help in purchasing fare tickets, and arrived at our destination. The concierge advice was very useful, giving us transportation choices, and indeed we used the loop bus #100 to return to the station. (Notable advice: if there is a ticket machine at the bus boarding area, take a ticket; if none exists, the fare is fixed price for any destination. The fare machine next to the driver makes change for bank notes, and the driver will help you by taking coins from your hand to match the required fare. We formed up at the end of the line so as to not delay all the other passengers who knew the system well.) On check-in be mindful of which elevators to use. North lifts serve some room numbers, and South serves others. Hotel Granvia offers three breakfast locations, and we chose the buffet. Good choice. Self-service latte etc coffee machine and variety to satisfy anyone. Before 8AM it is crowded with significant waiting time. Checkout is busy early in the morning, but at 9AM+ it was fast and easy. Lobby seating is insufficient if you have to wait for a train or something.

Show more
chanpen , Thailand
Hotel Gran Ms Kyoto
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1341 reviews

I pinch myself when I think about my first - 14 day experience in Kyoto & apan. I've told people I "lucked" out with my choice of staying at the Gran Ms Kyoto.

The location was perfect for my choice to tour some of the most important Zen Gardens/Temples that Kyoto has to offer. Once I got comfortable with the area - which was helped by the maps the staff gave me, I was able to take buses, trains, subways very easily. The location made it perfect for walking to and from many of the areas attractions. I was also very impressed by the staff, they were friendly and took the time to help a non Japanese traveler/speaker. I knew the room was going to be small and that's OK for me. The rates were great for a time of year (oct/nov) when things can be somewhat expensive for a busy period. Kyoto is a beautiful city and to appreciate it fully, you need to be in good location that is central to restaurants, temples, historic areas, shopping & nature - The Hotel Gran Ms Kyoto is perfect for all these adventures! Thanks once again to the staff, who were also perfect!

Show more
michael , Canada
Hotel Monterey Kyoto
8.5 Excellent
Based on 1561 reviews

We stayed at Hotel Monterey Kyoto for 3 nights at the end of our trip to Japan. Because we waited too long to book reservations, we had limited choices.

The hotel is located about a 7 minute taxi ride from Kyoto Station in a commercial section of Kyoto. Our room was mis-assigned (not the hotel's fault) and the first night we had a triple room in a room meant for 1-2 beds. Hotel staff corrected that for night's 2 and 3. The room was okay. Carpet needs cleaning, but the room was clean. The bathroom was fully stocked and had a shower in tub. The optional buffet breakfast featured a large selection of foods from Japanese to western style foods. There are 2 restaurants on site, very expensive. The decor is unusual - it's a Scottish themed hotel with Japanese influences. Dark woods throughout. Hotel does not offer money exchange services on site. Staff was courteous and helpful as one would expect.

Show more
Janice , United States
Sakura Terrace The Gallery
9 Excellent
Based on 1654 reviews

I had a really lovely time here. It's definitely a casual hotel (nice welcome but you'll never hear from the staff again) but once you're happy with that concept it's great.

The rooms are typically small which is no surprise but the inside/outside layout of he place gives it a nice openness and freshness. Not too much to do in the area if eating in a shopping centre of train station isn't the Japan you want but being so close to Kyoto station it's really easy to get around. I have to mention the breakfast - amazing! Well worth the 2300 yen if you haven't already paid for it. I generally don't like eating in hotel restaurants but we also had dinner there one evening and the food was so cheap it was almost confusing - I kept second guessing myself that I must be missing something. Anyway, overall really enjoyable experience but, without it necessarily being a negative, you won't be overwhelmed by the quality of the hotel - just a nice hotel.

Show more
Laurence , Ireland
Kyoto Royal Hotel & Spa
8.3 Excellent
Based on 2658 reviews

First of all, the location is simply fantastic. The rest is only borderline satisfactory. Our whole stay, the A/C is programmed for heater.

Unfortunately, you cannot control the temperature only the hotel and so we have to open our windows to make our room chilly and comfortable enough to sleep. What is even more unfortunate is that the location of our room is right in front the main street, so you can imagine the noise level at night given that we are only at the 4th floor. Secondly, since the hotel has no concierge, you can only talk to the front desk officers for any inquiries. Fortunately, many of them can speak and understand English very well. One bad encounter was when we were asking for assistance from them to get us a cab to Kyoto Station because we are ready to leave for Osaka the following day. The officer rudely told us to flag our own cabs, which took me and my sister by surprise. When I asked for his name, he simply told me that he is not on-duty the next day. My sister, who booked our hotel, told me that she will no longer stay at this hotel nor recommend it to anyone. Very disappointing.

Show more
czarina , United States
Hotel Kanra Kyoto
9 Excellent
Based on 585 reviews

Perhaps one of the nicest places to stay in Kyoto. We had the cheapest most basic room with one bed for 2 people, and I will have the say the room was amazing, even by western standards.

Japanese rooms are typically small but our place was spacious. It had a very minimal but modern design which we really enjoyed. This hotel is interesting since all the rooms have a wooden bathtub, if you fill it up with water, the whole shower/bath area will smell like that wood. It really is a "modern-ryokan" in a sense. The WIFI was great, and the customer service was amazing. We were even able to rent bikes for free from this hotel (had to return by 6pm), which were battery powered and really easy to use. Most of the staff speak some sort of English so it is easy to communicate if you are worried about that. If you have the money, I would recommend to stay here. Modern comforts in with a japanese minimalist design make it a great experience.

Show more
Steven , United States
Daiwa Roynet Hotel Kyoto-ekimae
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 443 reviews

Room is spacious with ample natural light. The twin beds are quite large, although a bit firm. Bathroom is larger than other hotels I've stayed at in Japan, particularly love the bathtub & rainfall shower.

At check in, they have amenities baskets for ladies and children, from which you can take whatever you like, which I thought was special. The staff may seem standoff-ish, but when they know you really need help, they are very helpful. They helped me book an airport limousine bus departing from my next hotel in Tokyo. Location is a 5-10 minute walk from Kyoto Station and just a stone's throw away from Kyoto Tower. The hotel also connects directly to Kyoto Station through the Porta on B1 level, which is convenient when it's raining. However, connecting to the Porta is through a series of steps (no elevator/escalator/ramp), so keep that in mind if you're travelling with a pram/stroller/wheelchair/large suitcase.

Show more
Melanie , Indonesia
Mitsui Garden Hotel Kyoto Shijo
8.4 Excellent
Based on 1452 reviews

we had a pleasant stay at mitsui. the staff is so pleasant and welcoming. always smiling. when we asked for a towel, they brought it in a bag for us.

when i forgot my key in my room, someone walked me to my room instead of handing me a spare key. it is in a quiet location. grocery shops and a few restarants nearby. 20-30 mins walking distance from nishiki or gion. room is tiny, as to be expected in japan. but they have all the amenities you can imagine. really enjoyed the onsen. it washed my tiredness away, they have the free massage chairs as well.

Show more
Jessica , Mauritius
Royal Park Hotel The Kyoto
8.9 Excellent
Based on 1038 reviews

Located within walking distance from sanjo station and a hop and a skip away from main artery Kawaramachi, we loved our stay here.

Starbucks was also a few minutes away (to the delight of my husband). It's a fifteen minute walk to gion, and pontocho is even closer. Check in and check out was a breeze, and the staff were helpful and friendly. You can purchase bus passes from the front desk, and they will gladly share tips about suggested itineraries and how best to get there. The room is compact (not a big surprise considering this is Japan) but cozy. They also provided us with old fashioned nightgowns that were quite comfortable! Lots of convenience stores and breakfast places around. Would definitely stay here again.

Show more
Liza , Philippines
RIHGA Royal Hotel Kyoto
8.5 Excellent
Based on 1065 reviews

Stayed in their Luxury Family (renovated non smoking) room for four nights. Room was clean and new as expected given the Hotel's recent renovation.

The layout was true to that as depicted on their website. Very generous with toiletries. Provided Laura Ashley shampoo and conditioner, body soap and lotion among others. There were also complimentary water and capsule coffee and tea. General feeling: elegant and luxurious although the exterior might not carry that image. Did not take advantage of the hotel's shuttle bus service since the distance between Kyoto Station and the Hotel is only about 750m. Value for money and very pleased with the stay. The breakfast was a little on the high side though - about ¥2700/adult. Highly recommend if you are willing to splurge a little for a bit more comfort and luxury.

Show more
Ai , Singapore
Urban Hotel Kyoto-Nijo Premium
8.8 Excellent
Based on 508 reviews

We were already surprised by the size of hotel room in Japan, so by the time we checked in we already knew this hotel is not out of the norm.

Unless you want to pay more than 200 usd/ night, room size will not be any bigger than this. The room was well designed, so even though it was small, it was very cozy and everything seems new. The location is good. There is a good french restaurant a few doors down. A 7-eleven, pharmacy, laundromat and a supermarket were all within a 5-minute walk. Nijo station is about 2-3 blocks away. Bus stop is right in front of 7-eleven which was like 20 meters away from the hotel and across the street. We could get to Kyoto station either by bus or train. JR train does go to Nijo station, so our JR pass came handy. The hotel has free public bath/ spa that guest can enjoy and on-site laundromat facility. We will stay at this hotel again.

Show more
minh , Vietnam
APA Hotel Kyoto-Ekimae
7.8 Very good
Based on 1011 reviews

This hotel is a bit pricey compare to the similar leveled hotel. The light is too dim in the room; the room is too small, which you cannot unpack your luggage on the floor; the things is in really bad and non-logical placement in the room (the water boiler is behind the TV), etc.

The English skills of the staffs are not good, it is very hard to communicate if you do not know a bit Japanese. However, they are willing to help. The positive side of this hotel is that it is very close to Kyoto Station, JR and Bus station, which save a lot of time.

Show more
Wing , Hong Kong
Hotel Keihan Kyoto GRANDE
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1315 reviews

Between 2016-05-22 and 2016-05-24,my family and I (three persons) staying at The Hotel Keihan Kyoto for sight seeing.

When we arrived at the hotel, we found the room is so small. Only the cleaning worker is nice, the staff of the reception check in counter are seldom smile to customer , At about 14:50 hrs on 2016-05-24, we took the coach at No, 5 terminal of OCAT Kyoto for Osaka. Before we got in the coach, we proceeded to the OCAT reception counter (a lady, about 35 yrs, also without smile) for enquiry can we used the ICOCA card ( store value card) she replied that you can. Finally the coach arrived in OCAT Terminal, OSaja at about 16:15 hrs, we used the ICOCA card paid for the coach, the driver ( a gentleman, about 50-55 yrs) spoke in Japanese and looked like angry and rude manner. I felt he disliked us to use the store value card to pay the fare or he is discrimination the passenger speaking English. We have an unpleasant experience in Hotel Jeihan Kyoto and The OCAT, Kyoto.

Show more
Steven , Hong Kong
Kyoto Granbell Hotel
9.3 Exceptional
Based on 58 reviews

This place was truly beautiful! The onsen in the bottom floor of the hotel - even in the heat of summer - was AMAZING.

We used the onsen every night and were so sad to leave this place. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The hotel also has nice coin-operated laundry facility downstairs although this isn't listed in their facilities on their website. The breakfast was alright - fine if you needed an early breakfast but not worth the price (around 1,800 yen) in my opinion when there are some other options nearby. The only thing to mention is the room we had was on a basement floor, which some might think is strange but it still worked well. There was plenty of natural light as there was an open to air garden outside the big window which starts at the basement floor and reaches up. This hotel is located in the Gion district, from the hotel you can meander through beautifully lit narrow streets towards the 'Geisha district' at Hanami-koji. In the other direction, you have Kamo Gawa two minutes walk away - an incredible part of Kyoto full of fun and great restaurants. This was easily the best hotel we stayed at in Japan (out of 6 hotels).

8.9 Excellent
Based on 360 reviews

Booked for five nights and requested a room at the back of the hotel after reading other reviews about road noise.

It was very quiet. Location is good, with a bus stop literally steps from the front door. NB: from Kyoto station, make sure to catch the 206 from bus bay A3 - this one heads northwest towards Shijo Omiya. Alight at Shimabaraguchi. (The 206 service from bus bay D2 goes northeast towards Gion - we found this out the hard way, with luggage in tow as well!). Fewer nearby restaurants than other, busier parts of Kyoto. Kyoto station is reasonably nearby (15 - 20 mins) with lots of food options - Porta Dining on B1 has plenty of excellent choices. Just southeast of the station (also 15 - 20 min walk) is an AEON mall, with a food floor, including a food court, on the 4th floor. Room is well set-up, and a good size in comparison to a Japanese hotel room. We really appreciated the extra space. It also has an excellent Japanese-style bathroom and a little kitchenette, but definitely BYO kitchen utensils if you want to eat in. Two mugs and some paper cups are provided, there is also a stove-top kettle and small fridge/freezer. The only drawback was that the bed was really hard, I could feel the springs in the mattress. The staff member we met - Masa - was very helpful and spoke good English. The check-in system works very well, especially if you arrive outside of office hours. I would definitely choose to stay here again.

More about Kyoto

The former imperial capital, Kyoto is a very important city in Japan's history. Many of the buildings and palaces in Kyoto are thousands of years old and the city is regarded by many to be the most beautiful in Japan. Kyoto has 17 areas listed as UNESCO World Heritage sites, most of which are temples and shrines like Kinkaku Temple.

Kyoto Station is a popular entry point into the city and, as with most of Japan, the rail network provides access to all the city's most important sites. The two most impressive imperial retreats, Imperial Palace and Sentō Imperial Palace, are located in central Kyoto. The gardens are extensive and particularly beautiful during cherry blossom season and in autumn when the colors of the leaves change.

Katsura Imperial Villa is located in Western Kyoto and Shugakuin Imperial Villa is located in the north. Kyoto's nightlife is concentrated around the Kiyamachi area in central Kyoto. There are hundreds of bars ranging from pubs to exclusive bars all throughout the area, as well as restaurants and night clubs. Kyoto is a city rich in history and charm, and visitors to this area will not be in want of exciting and interesting activities.

There’s much more to see and learn about Kyoto, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.

The location is just perfect for us as we had gotten the hotel to make most of our restaurants reservations, mostly around the GION district area. Quite a number of sightseeing places (famous Shrines & Temples) are within walking distance. It is especially good for us as we can walk off the calories after our lunch and before heading back to hotel to freshen up and then for dinner. The room size is pretty good and everything is so new and clean.. even the hotel smells good too! Room rate is considered reasonable given the high rates in most hotels in Kyoto. Overall,we are happy and satisfied with the stay at Celestine Kyoto Gion. The only problem (not big though) is you have to be rather patience with the staff if communicating in English with them. Anyway, will definitely stay at this hotel again. Show more Geraldine , Singapore Kyoto Century Hotel 8.9 Excellent Based on 1687 reviews We chose this hotel for location, close to JR station, making it convenient to travel day trips by JR. The hotel was newly renovated, so all room and facilities are nice and clean. It is a non smoking hotel. Staff polite and helpful. We were very happy that we got upgraded to a deluxe room, that make our stay even more memorable. The breakfast was excellent although the food is pretty much the same each morning. We had the Valentine' Day dinner in the hotel, and the food was great, over all, a very happy stay. The sink is separated from the toilet/bathroom, which is a convenient design. One minor thing is that there is no soap available next to the sink and we have to go back to the bathroom to squeeze liquid soap to clean up our hands each time after toilet. The room is big in Japanese standard and very clean. We didn't try the dining hall but there's a supermarket, convenience store, several restaurants right next to the hotel. A short 10 min walk will take you to the busy Shijo area and Nishiki market. Would definitely stay here again! Show more Wing , Hong Kong Kyoto Brighton Hotel 8.7 Excellent Based on 593 reviews Excelent hotel, not so good location unless one knows about the shuttle bus! Show more Renato , United States Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Kyoto Premier 9.3 Exceptional Based on 289 reviews My family of five had a wonderful stay at this property. Our three kids, 14, 12, & 10, had a room around the corner in a twin + rollaway, it was called a triple. My partner and I shared a twin double, which two beds were pushed together (I don't quite get this, but it worked out just fine). We were located on the 2nd floor, which was free of any of the smoke issues as reported by other reviewers. My opinion is, that if you are concerned with smoking as I am, you really have to call a manager on the property, and ask what their policies are on smoking. Japan is still a country in transition when it comes to the definition of a "non-smoking room". The entire property is very clean, and well appointed. The location is excellent --between the bustle of downtown and gion. The property sits alongside the riverside, and is a block away from the two major subway lines. Hint, the subway passes are different between the two systems :) Runners and bikers (another hint, rent a bike and ride along the river paved paths) will love this location. Adults will love the public baths... The rooms are "cozy", but on par with other boutique hotels. The triple rooms were tight on space. The twin, had a small couch and table. There is a washer dryer on site (one on the mens side, and two on the women's). the women's machine is available only to women. The english of the staff can be a little rough, but there was always someone available who could come in and help a poor english only speaking person like myself. The breakfast is EXCELLENT. However, unless it is included for free, I would suggest that you purchase it on your first morning... and then forage outside afterwards in the many options in the neighborhood. I think it's about ~2500 yen. It's just a lot of food! Do take advantage of the hotel's excellent, knowledgeable, thoughful concierge. They also have a fancy coin machine, which my kids loved, that will convert your bag full of coins into larger more Show more michael , United States Hotel Granvia Kyoto 9 Excellent Based on 1398 reviews The JR station in Kyoto is a city within itself, and the Hotel Granvia is the Manor House. The place is immense. Upon arrival, looking out from a window onto the city, the thought of venturing into the streets on foot was daunting. How long would it take to escape the station complex and start a walking tour was an uncomfortable thought. The Granvia concierge was excellent in English and cheerful and patient in marking up a city map for us, but still we were stumbling around for a while. Nevertheless, we finally found the subway entrance, and finally got some help in purchasing fare tickets, and arrived at our destination. The concierge advice was very useful, giving us transportation choices, and indeed we used the loop bus #100 to return to the station. (Notable advice: if there is a ticket machine at the bus boarding area, take a ticket; if none exists, the fare is fixed price for any destination. The fare machine next to the driver makes change for bank notes, and the driver will help you by taking coins from your hand to match the required fare. We formed up at the end of the line so as to not delay all the other passengers who knew the system well.) On check-in be mindful of which elevators to use. North lifts serve some room numbers, and South serves others. Hotel Granvia offers three breakfast locations, and we chose the buffet. Good choice. Self-service latte etc coffee machine and variety to satisfy anyone. Before 8AM it is crowded with significant waiting time. Checkout is busy early in the morning, but at 9AM+ it was fast and easy. Lobby seating is insufficient if you have to wait for a train or something. Show more chanpen , Thailand Hotel Gran Ms Kyoto 8.6 Excellent Based on 1341 reviews I pinch myself when I think about my first - 14 day experience in Kyoto & apan. I've told people I "lucked" out with my choice of staying at the Gran Ms Kyoto. The location was perfect for my choice to tour some of the most important Zen Gardens/Temples that Kyoto has to offer. Once I got comfortable with the area - which was helped by the maps the staff gave me, I was able to take buses, trains, subways very easily. The location made it perfect for walking to and from many of the areas attractions. I was also very impressed by the staff, they were friendly and took the time to help a non Japanese traveler/speaker. I knew the room was going to be small and that's OK for me. The rates were great for a time of year (oct/nov) when things can be somewhat expensive for a busy period. Kyoto is a beautiful city and to appreciate it fully, you need to be in good location that is central to restaurants, temples, historic areas, shopping & nature - The Hotel Gran Ms Kyoto is perfect for all these adventures! Thanks once again to the staff, who were also perfect! Carpet needs cleaning, but the room was clean. The bathroom was fully stocked and had a shower in tub. The optional buffet breakfast featured a large selection of foods from Japanese to western style foods. There are 2 restaurants on site, very expensive. The decor is unusual - it's a Scottish themed hotel with Japanese influences. Dark woods throughout. Hotel does not offer money exchange services on site. Staff was courteous and helpful as one would expect. Show more Janice , United States Sakura Terrace The Gallery 9 Excellent Based on 1654 reviews I had a really lovely time here. The rooms are typically small which is no surprise but the inside/outside layout of he place gives it a nice openness and freshness. Not too much to do in the area if eating in a shopping centre of train station isn't the Japan you want but being so close to Kyoto station it's really easy to get around. I have to mention the breakfast - amazing! Well worth the 2300 yen if you haven't already paid for it. I generally don't like eating in hotel restaurants but we also had dinner there one evening and the food was so cheap it was almost confusing - I kept second guessing myself that I must be missing something. Anyway, overall really enjoyable experience but, without it necessarily being a negative, you won't be overwhelmed by the quality of the hotel - just a nice hotel. Secondly, since the hotel has no concierge, you can only talk to the front desk officers for any inquiries. Fortunately, many of them can speak and understand English very well. One bad encounter was when we were asking for assistance from them to get us a cab to Kyoto Station because we are ready to leave for Osaka the following day. It is only a 15 minute walk from Kyoto Station and there's a bus stop right on the main road less than 50 metres from the apartment. ?Overall a very good location. Unit is a bit small, but that is normal in Japan. The favilities were very clean. But we were impressed with the kitchenette. It came with an oven toaster, microwave, rice cooker and stove. Also glasses, mugs, plates, bowls and cutlery. So if you're staying for a week or more, you can even prepare your own food. The place itself is nice and clean, with large window and lots of light. Make sure you rent bikes from the owner on checkin. $1 a day and you'll use them a lot (riding to the station or shops), they have their own wheel locks attached and are very convenient and one of the best things about Kyoto (check the light generator works when picking one). The girl that met us on checkin was super friendly and very very helpful, great english ask her anything about tourist sites etc. The bed is bad... Really bad. I've slept on bad beds around Asia. This is the worst! Its basically two; only what can describe as 'large type things' pushed together. Its not large enough though really, and although they have soft middles, they have hard edges, which being pushed together, meet right where your back is. So there is a double hard ridge in your back. Like as hard as a metal rod. I'm 5'9 and I only just fit on the 'bed'. You will mess up your back. I like hard beds and have had no problem with any bed in SE Asia.... But this one, seriously. There is a washing machine but I couldn't get it to work because it is only in Korean, no instructions or symbols on it, so that's a huge shame. There is LAN for a laptop but no WiFi if you only have a tablet or phone only. Not that many restaurants around that part of town, but a short ride to the station (less than 5min on bike) has a few. 7eleven, family mart, and circle k stores close by. Show more Vo Thi Ngoc ,Vietnam Discover the neighborhoods of Kyoto Central Kyoto 1298 hotels Kyoto Station 1010 hotels Higashiyama 709 hotels North Kyoto 216 hotels South Kyoto 213 hotels Biwako 121 hotels Arashiyama 101 hotels Yamashina 22 hotels Kusatsu City 20 hotels Nantan 19 hotels Kameoka 18 hotels Ohara 12 hotels Nagaokakyo 6 hotels Muko 4 hotels Minamiyamashiro 3 hotels Mount Hiei 3 hotels Kasagi 3 hotels Seika 2 hotels Wazuka 2 hotels Kizugawa 1 hotel Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Kyoto 994 Guest Houses in Kyoto 356 Ryokans in Kyoto 207 Hostels in Kyoto 66 Serviced Apartments in Kyoto 36 Love Hotels in Kyoto 32 Villas in Kyoto 16 Capsule Hotels in Kyoto 11 More about Kyoto The former imperial capital, Kyoto is a very important city in Japan's history. Many of the buildings and palaces in Kyoto are thousands of years old and the city is regarded by many to be the most beautiful in Japan. Kyoto has 17 areas listed as UNESCO World Heritage sites, most of which are temples and shrines like Kinkaku Temple . Kyoto Station is a popular entry point into the city and, as with most of Japan, the rail network provides access to all the city's most important sites. The two most impressive imperial retreats, Imperial Palace and Sentō Imperial Palace, are located in central Kyoto. The gardens are extensive and particularly beautiful during cherry blossom season and in autumn when the colors of the leaves change. Katsura Imperial Villa is located in Western Kyoto and Shugakuin Imperial Villa is located in the north. Kyoto's nightlife is concentrated around the Kiyamachi area in central Kyoto. There are hundreds of bars ranging from pubs to exclusive bars all throughout the area, as well as restaurants and night clubs. Kyoto is a city rich in history and charm, and visitors to this area will not be in want of exciting and interesting activities. There’s much more to see and learn about Kyoto, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.
